title: Dormancy Could Be One of the Keys to Life on Earth (and Beyond) - Universe Today
summary:
Dormancy Could Be One of the Keys to Life on Earth (and Beyond)

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Universe Today

This article discusses the concept of dormancy as a vital survival strategy for organisms on Earth and its implications for the potential existence of life on other planets. Dormancy allows life to endure harsh conditions and may be a crucial factor for the survival of life throughout Earth's history and possibly beyond.

  • Dormancy is an evolutionary trait that enables organisms to survive adverse conditions.
  • The article highlights a study published in The Royal Society Journals discussing dormancy theory.
  • Dormancy may have helped organisms survive past extinction events.
  • The ability to enter dormancy might allow life to exist on other planets with harsh environments.
“Dormancy is a state of reduced activity or metabolism that organisms enter to survive during challenging environmental conditions.”

In conclusion, understanding dormancy not only sheds light on the resilience of life on Earth but also expands our perspective on the possibilities of life beyond our planet.
newTitle: Dormancy Could Be One of the Keys to Life on Earth (and Beyond)

title: Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over Rs 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling? - News18
‘PM Modi, Kejriwal failed to reduce inflation': Rahul Gandhi at Delhi rally - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘PM Modi, Kejriwal failed to reduce inflation': Rahul Gandhi at Delhi rally

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi, Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, accused PM Narendra Modi and AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal of failing to address rising inflation during a rally in Delhi.

  • Gandhi stated that inflation is at its peak, adversely affecting the poor.
  • He criticized Modi's relationship with industrialists Ambani and Adani, calling for a more equitable society.
  • Gandhi emphasized the need to protect the Constitution from perceived threats posed by the BJP and RSS.
  • Both the Congress and AAP are contesting upcoming Delhi elections separately.
  • The Delhi assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, with counting on February 8.
“Inflation is at its peak. Poor people are becoming poorer and rich people are becoming richer.”

In conclusion, Gandhi’s remarks highlight significant discontent with current leadership's economic policies as both parties prepare for a competitive electoral battle.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Criticizes Modi and Kejriwal for Inflation Issues at Delhi Rally

title: 6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Galaxies Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
summary:
6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Galaxies Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: Times Now

This article showcases six breathtaking images of galaxies captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting advancements in astronomical imaging.

  • The Antennae Galaxies captured with Hubble's advanced imaging capabilities.
  • Messier 106 visualized combining Hubble data with contributions from amateur astronomers.
  • The Large Magellanic Cloud depicted beautifully, emphasizing its spectacular hues.
  • Messier 94, located 16 million light-years away, showcasing its intricate beauty.
  • NGC 3256, a galaxy noted for its unusual features, captured in detail.
  • NGC 4522 illustrating the process of ram pressure stripping affecting the galaxy.
"These images not only capture visual beauty but also contribute to our understanding of the universe's structure and formation processes."

In conclusion, the Hubble Space Telescope continues to amaze us with its ability to capture the beauty and complexity of galaxies, inspiring further exploration and study of the cosmos.
newTitle: Stunning Hubble Space Telescope Images of Galaxies

title: JSW Group’s JSW Cement gets Sebi nod for ₹4000 crore IPO; details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
JSW Cement Secures SEBI Approval for ₹4000 Crore IPO

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Live Mint

JSW Cement Limited, a part of JSW Group, has received approval from SEBI to raise ₹4000 crore through an initial public offering (IPO).

  • The IPO consists of a fresh issue of shares worth ₹2000 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of ₹2000 crore.
  • The offer for sale includes contributions from AP Asia Opportunistic Holdings Pte. Ltd., Synergy Metals Investments, and State Bank of India.
  • Funds will be allocated for establishing a new cement facility in Rajasthan and repaying outstanding borrowings.
  • JSW Cement is one of the fastest-growing cement manufacturers in India.
“The company achieved a 31.11% rise in sales volume in Fiscal 2023, significantly outpacing the industry average growth of 6.35%.”

The approval of this IPO is a significant step for JSW Cement in expanding its operations and enhancing its market presence.
newTitle: JSW Cement Secures SEBI Approval for ₹4000 Crore IPO

summary:

In a recent discussion, Kapil Dev emphasizes the differences between cricket eras and critiques the notion of 'workload management' in modern players, especially in context of Jasprit Bumrah's recent injuries.

  • Kapil Dev argues against comparisons between players of different generations.

title: Magnitude 6.9 earthquake rattles southwestern Japan, followed by tsunami warnings - The Indian Express
summary:
Magnitude 6.9 earthquake rattles southwestern Japan, followed by tsunami warnings

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Japan Meteorological Agency

A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.9 has struck southwestern Japan, prompting tsunami warnings for affected regions. The quake was centered in Miyazaki Prefecture and occurred at 9:19 p.m. local time.

  • The earthquake registered a magnitude of 6.9.
  • Tsunami warnings were issued for Miyazaki and Kochi Prefectures.
  • The extent of damage remains unclear at this time.
Japan is frequently hit by earthquakes because of its location along the “Ring of Fire”, an arc of volcanoes and fault lines in the Pacific Basin.

While details on damages are still emerging, communities are advised to stay vigilant as the situation develops.
newTitle: Magnitude 6.9 Earthquake Hits Southwestern Japan, Tsunami Warnings Issued

title: Watch Live As NASA Astronauts Upgrade the ISS and Hunt for Microbial Life - SciTechDaily
summary:
NASA Astronauts Conduct Spacewalks to Upgrade ISS and Search for Microbial Life

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: SciTechDaily

NASA astronauts are set to embark on two critical spacewalks in January to upgrade the International Space Station (ISS) hardware and search for microorganisms.

  • First spacewalk (U.S. Spacewalk 91) on January 16, lasting 6.5 hours.
  • Second spacewalk (U.S. Spacewalk 92) on January 23, also lasting 6.5 hours.
  • Tasks include replacing a rate gyro assembly and collecting surface material samples for analysis.
"We aim to explore and understand better what exists on the surface of the ISS." - NASA Operations Integration Manager Bill Spetch

These missions demonstrate the ongoing maintenance and research efforts vital to the ISS's functionality and safety.
newTitle: NASA Astronauts Conduct Spacewalks to Upgrade ISS and Search for Microbial Life

title: Japan issues tsunami advisory after 6.9 magnitude quake - The Hindu
summary:
Magnitude 6.9 Earthquake Hits Southwestern Japan with Tsunami Advisories

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.9 has struck southwestern Japan, causing tsunami warnings and evacuation orders in affected areas.

  • The earthquake occurred at 9:19 p.m. local time, with its epicenter in Miyazaki Prefecture.
  • Tsunami advisories were issued for Miyazaki and Kochi Prefectures.
  • No immediate reports of significant damage have been received.
  • Tsunami waves of approximately 20 cm were detected at Miyazaki Port.
  • Japan's geography on the “Ring of Fire” makes it prone to earthquakes.
“Residents in the coastal city in Kochi were told to evacuate as a precautionary measure.”

The event highlights the ongoing seismic risks in Japan and the preparedness of its public safety measures against such natural disasters.

Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw criticized Mark Zuckerberg's remark that India's ruling party lost major elections, stressing the importance of factual accuracy during discussions.

title: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Attrition rate rises to 13.2%; 2,014 freshers added | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
HCL Tech Q3 Results: Attrition Rate Rises to 13.2%; 2,014 Freshers Added

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: Live Mint

HCL Technologies reported an increase in its attrition rate to 13.2% for Q3 FY25, with a total headcount of 220,755. The company added 2,014 freshers during the quarter.

  • Attrition rate increased from 12.8% last year to 13.2% this year.
  • Gained net addition of 2,134 employees, compared to 3,617 in the previous year.
  • Revenue growth of 5.1% year-on-year to ₹29,890 crore.
  • EBIT increased by 3.7% YoY to ₹5,821 crore.
  • Profit after tax grew by 5.5% YoY to ₹4,591 crore.
“HCLTech delivers another quarter of solid growth at 3.8% QoQ in constant currency and EBIT at 19.5%.” - C Vijayakumar, CEO & Managing Director, HCL Tech

Overall, HCL Tech continues to perform robustly amid fluctuating attrition rates and economic conditions.
newTitle: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Attrition Rate Rises to 13.2%; 2,014 Freshers Added

title: On India-China border situation, Army chief rules out ‘buffer zones’ along LAC - Hindustan Times
summary:
Army Chief Discusses India-China Border Stability and Disengagement

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi stated that the border situation with China is stable but sensitive, denying the existence of buffer zones along the Line of Actual Control (LAC).

  • Both Indian and Chinese armies completed disengagement at Depsang and Demchok in eastern Ladakh last October.
  • General Dwivedi emphasized the need for a broader understanding to rebuild trust.
  • Verification patrolling has been successfully conducted by both sides.
"It is stable but sensitive... overall, both sides will remain back and will not go to the common areas because we still feel that if we meet at those places, the violence level may go high." - General Upendra Dwivedi

This ongoing dialogue and military disengagement are crucial for maintaining peace along the contentious border.
newTitle: Army Chief Discusses India-China Border Stability and Disengagement

title: PM Modi, accompanied by Nitin Gadkari, Omar Abdullah, and others, inaugurates Z-Morh tunnel in J&K’s Sonamarg - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Inaugurates Strategic Z-Morh Tunnel in Sonamarg, J&K

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Z-Morh tunnel in Sonamarg, J&K, aimed at enhancing connectivity and tourism in the region. Despite questions about statehood, he emphasized national integration through infrastructure development.

  • The 6.5-kilometer Z-Morh tunnel cost ₹2,700 crore and enables year-round access to Sonamarg, boosting tourism.
  • Modi acknowledged the dedication of construction workers despite previous militant attacks that claimed lives.
  • The tunnel will facilitate smoother access for residents and tourists, reducing previous isolation during harsh weather.
  • PM mentioned ongoing and upcoming projects contributing to J&K's connectivity, including the Zojila tunnel and multiple national highways.
“I salute the dedication of workers who braved harsh weather conditions and even risked their lives to complete this project.”

The Z-Morh tunnel represents a significant step in improving infrastructure and connectivity in J&K, potentially transforming the region's economic landscape and societal dynamics.

title: HCL Tech Q3 Results: PAT grows 6% YoY to Rs 4,591 crore, revenue up 5%, Rs 18 dividend declared - The Economic Times
summary:
HCL Technologies Q3 Results: PAT grows 6% YoY to Rs 4,591 crore, revenue up 5%, Rs 18 dividend declared

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Economic Times

HCL Technologies reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 4,591 crore for the quarter ended December 2024, marking a 6% increase year-over-year. The revenue from operations grew by 5% to Rs 29,890 crore.

  • Net profit stands at Rs 4,591 crore compared to Rs 4,350 crore last year.
  • Revenue from operations rose to Rs 29,890 crore compared to Rs 28,446 crore a year ago.
  • Declared a fourth interim dividend of Rs 18 per share, including a special dividend of Rs 6 per share.
  • Operating EBIT rose by 4% YoY, totaling Rs 5,821 crore.
  • Revenue growth in constant currency (CC) terms is 4% YoY.
  • New deal bookings reached $2.1 billion.
  • Company added 2,134 employees during Q3.
  • Closing cash balance reached Rs 27,707 crore.
“HCL Tech is well positioned as AI-led transformation brings new opportunities for growth,” said Roshni Nadar, Chairperson, HCL Tech.

In conclusion, HCL Technologies showcases resilient financial growth, driven by strong performance across various sectors as it prepares for continued expansion in the digital landscape.
newTitle: HCL Technologies Reports Q3 Growth in Profit and Revenue

title: Stock market crash: 5 reasons why Sensex tanked by over 1,000 points - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stock market crash: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) benchmark index Sensex tanked by 1,048.90 points to close at 76,330

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 13, 2025, the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) saw a significant drop in the Sensex index, falling by over 1,000 points due to various negative market influences.

  • The crash was largely attributed to unfavorable global market cues.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) sold off equities worth ₹2,254.68 crore.
  • The rupee fell to a historic low against the US dollar, exacerbating market conditions.
  • Brent crude oil prices surged above $80 a barrel, raising inflation concerns.
  • Upcoming budget expectations contributed to a restrained market sentiment.
“Rising crude oil prices would raise concerns of a spike in domestic inflation, which could further delay any rate cut hopes from the RBI in the near to medium term.” – Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd

This dramatic drop in the stock market reflects broader economic uncertainties and highlights the interconnectedness of global events affecting domestic markets.
newTitle: Reasons Behind the 1,000 Point Drop in Sensex

title: 92 HMPV test kits arrive in Jamshedpur, testing to begin today - Avenue Mail
summary:
Jamshedpur Receives 92 HMPV Test Kits to Begin Testing

Publication Date: Today, Source: The Avenue Mail

In light of the increasing cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) across the country, Jamshedpur is preparing to confront the potential health threat as 92 test kits arrive for testing.

The testing will start on Monday, with the focus on early detection to prevent the virus's spread.

  • 92 test kits have been supplied to the Virus Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (VRDL).
  • Testing for HMPV will start on Monday.
  • Five suspected patients will be tested weekly as per ICMR guidelines.
  • No confirmed cases in Jamshedpur yet, but readiness is key.
  • The district is ramping up surveillance efforts to monitor potential cases.
“Updated information about the HMPV virus is continuously coming in. We are preparing accordingly.” - Dr. Diwakar Hansda

The authorities are closely monitoring the situation, with further guidelines expected as new cases are identified.

The Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, known as the biggest religious congregation in the world, is taking place with heightened excitement due to a rare celestial alignment occurring only once in 144 years.

  • The Triveni Sangam, where the Ganga, Yamuna, and mythical Saraswati meet, is a key pilgrimage site.
  • Sadhus from various parts of India participate, setting up camps along the riverbank.

  • Devotees are advised to approach the event with humility and reverence.
“Now it’s more of a show than a kumbh,” says Mahamandeshwar Ji Maharaj of the Juna Akhada.

title: Why rupee breached 86 against US dollar: strengthening dollar, weak FII inflows - The Indian Express
summary:
Why the Rupee Breached 86 Against US Dollar: Strengthening Dollar, Weak FII Inflows

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Indian Express

The rupee fell past the 86 mark against the US dollar on account of a strengthening dollar and weakening foreign institutional investor inflows, amid rising crude oil prices.

  • The rupee opened at 86.12 and hit a low of 86.31 against the dollar.
  • Factors leading to this depreciation include a strong dollar and high crude oil prices.
  • The US jobs report showed NFP at 256,000, outpacing expectations.
  • Capital outflows from Indian markets have reached approximately $4.2 billion in January 2025.
  • The rupee is expected to trade within the range of 85.80–86.50 in the near term.
“This sustained decline reflects a combination of global and domestic pressures.” - Amit Pabari, Managing Director, CR Forex Advisors
newTitle: Why the Rupee Fell Past 86 Against the US Dollar
